ai.summary: A quick 0.6 km coastal stroll along North Sandwick in Yell, Scotland, UK. An easy route with sea views and grassy paths suitable for families and casual walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat to gently undulating coastal path. Ground varies from compacted soil and grass to small rocky patches near the shore. Expect damp conditions after rain and strong coastal winds.
ai.safety_notes: Coastal exposure can bring strong winds; check weather forecast before set-off. Stay away from cliff edges and be cautious on rocky sections. Tide is less of a factor on this short stretch, but water spray and waves can be unpredictable. Wear sturdy footwear, dress in layers, carry a water bottle and a mobile phone, and keep dogs under control where required.
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with best conditions in late spring to early autumn. Winter visits are possible but may be cold, windy, and wet.
